summary:
A likelihood ratio quantifies the probative value of evidence given the prosecution and defence propositions.

A likelihood ratio communicates how much more likely it is that a suspect is guilty compared to innocent.

A likelihood ratio quantifies the relative size of the probability of the prosecution proposition compared to the probability of the defence proposition.

A likelihood ratio communicates whether the prosecution or defence proposition is true.

LRs much greater/smaller than 1 indicate a greater degree of support in favour of the prosecution/defence proposition, and therefore greater probative value of the evidence.

LRs much greater/smaller than 1 indicate a lower degree of support in favour of the prosecution/defence proposition, and therefore lower probative value of the evidence.

In Bayes' rule, the LR acts as the updating factor for prior beliefs to become posterior beliefs.

In Bayes' rule, the LR acts as the updating factor for posterior beliefs to become prior beliefs.

In Bayes' rule, the LR acts as the odds prior to observing any conclusions from analysing evidence.

In Bayes' rule, the LR acts as the odds after having observed and accounted for conclusions from analysing evidence.

Under certain circumstances, LRs for different evidence types can be combined to communicate the joint probative value of the evidence.

LRs for different evidence types cannot be combined together.

In any scenario, LRs for different evidence types can be combined by multiplication to communicate the joint probative value of the evidence.

The robustness of an LR depends upon factors which are knowable and assessable.

All LRs are equally robust.

LRs based solely on experience are unreliable.

The robustness of an LR depends upon factors which are unknowable and therefore not assessable.

In forensic science, LRs are often communicated using a scale of verbal categories corresponding to ranges of numerical values.

In forensic science, LRs are only communicated using their numerical value.

In forensic science, LRs are only communicated using a possible range for their numerical value.

In forensic science, LRs are only communicated using a verbal category without detailing what the category corresponds to.
